description.#cdata-section: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: OpenAI investors push to bring Altman back as CEO one day after he was ousted by board

description.#cdata-section: Some OpenAI investors are joining together to try to get Sam Altman to return as CEO after the board fired him on Friday

item.title: SpaceX’s Starship rocket reaches space but is intentionally destroyed mid-flight

description.#cdata-section: SpaceX launched its second Starship rocket flight on Saturday, with Elon Musk's company pushing development of the mammoth vehicle past new milestones.

item.title: Sam Altman's last days as OpenAI CEO gave no indication trouble was brewing

description.#cdata-section: In the weeks leading up to Sam Altman's ouster on Friday, the OpenAI CEO was as active in public as ever

item.title: Apple, Disney, other media companies pause advertising on X after Elon Musk boosted antisemitic tweet

description.#cdata-section: Apple, Disney, Warner Bros., Comcast, and Lions Gate have paused online ad campaigns on X after owner Elon Musk made antisemitic comments on the platform.

item.title: PGA Tour, TGL assessing timeline for Tiger Woods' new golf league after dome collapse

description.#cdata-section: TGL's Florida dome venue suffered damage earlier this week, potentially threatening the January launch of the Tiger Woods-backed league.

item.title: Amazon cuts 'several hundred' jobs in Alexa division

description.#cdata-section: The company's devices and services unit, which includes Alexa, was hit by an earlier round of layoffs.

item.title: Why ‘how was school?’ isn’t a good question to ask kids. Here's what to say instead

description.#cdata-section: "Most adults want to switch off after work and let go of their day — children are the same," one child psychologist says.

item.title: This key element of ESG investing could drive real change at companies and boost returns

description.#cdata-section: As environment and board diversity initiatives have gained broad acceptance, some are now trying to clarify the case for the middle pillar of ESG.

item.title: Jim Chanos, the short seller who called Enron's fall, is converting hedge fund to a family office

description.#cdata-section: The veteran investor, known for his bets against Tesla and Enron, will convert his hedge fund to a family office and advisory business, CNBC has learned.

item.title: Disney's box office problems ramp up pressure on CEO Bob Iger and studio chief Alan Bergman

description.#cdata-section: Disney CEO Bob Iger's rare candor about creative misses increases the pressure on leadership to ensure 2024's films hit quality standards.

item.title: Cadillac reveals its new entry-level EV, a compact crossover called the Optiq

description.#cdata-section: The General Motors brand says the vehicle, which will be its fourth EV, will slot below the Lyriq midsize crossover, which starts around $59,000.

item.title: Germany approves financial reforms to help its tech industry compete with Silicon Valley

description.#cdata-section: Germany on Friday approved a litany of changes to its rules for stock-based compensation at tech startups, listing of companies and taxation.

item.title: Ex-Meta staffers see booming business targeting online disinformation after two wars break out

description.#cdata-section: With online disinformation and violent content spreading more rapidly since the Israel-Hamas war broke out, new startups are seeing a boom in demand.

item.title: Ford union workers ratify UAW deal, closing out historic negotiations with Detroit automakers

description.#cdata-section: A majority of Ford facilities overwhelmingly approved the deal, which, like those with GM and Stellantis, includes at least 25% wage increases.

item.title: These are the top 10 trending travel destinations for 2024—only 1 U.S. city made the list

description.#cdata-section: American Express Travel published its 2024 trending destinations list, featuring must-visit vacation spots.

item.title: T-Mobile sued after employee stole nude images from customer phone during trade-in

description.#cdata-section: T-Mobile has been sued again for failing to protect consumer data after an employee at one of its Washington stores stole nude images off of a customer's phone.

item.title: The 'Apple of e-bikes' targets profitability next year even as rivals enter bankruptcy

description.#cdata-section: Adrien Roose, CEO and co-founder of e-bike firm Cowboy, told CNBC this week that he expects the company  to reach profitability on a full-year basis in 2024.

item.title: Alibaba sheds over $20 billion in market value after scrapping plans to list its cloud business

description.#cdata-section: Alibaba lost more than $21 billion in market cap off the back of its ill-fated cloud spinoff plans, according to CNBC calculations of data from FactSet.

item.title: Rolls-Royce shares at one-year high despite 'defective' engine jibes from Emirates boss

description.#cdata-section: Shares of Rolls-Royce are at a 52-week high, up just under 190% in the span of a year.

item.title: ECB's Lagarde: Increasing signs that the global economy is fragmenting into competing blocs

description.#cdata-section: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said that Europe is now at a critical juncture.

item.title: China's transition to EVs is so fast that Volkswagen is on track for its worst local sales in years

description.#cdata-section: Volkswagen is on track for its smallest year of China sales since 2012, according to CNBC analysis of public data for the first three quarters of the year.

item.title: Most overused passwords in the world — make sure yours isn't on the list

description.#cdata-section: NordPass has revealed its study of the 200 most common passwords in 2023. Is yours on the list?

item.title: Charlie Munger says there isn't the slightest chance Buffett traded own account to enrich himself

description.#cdata-section: Berkshire Hathaway Vice Chairman Charlie Munger pushed back against a ProPublica report about Warren Buffett's personal trading.

item.title: Coal use needs to be slashed seven times faster to meet emissions target, analysis finds

description.#cdata-section: The authors of the report propose a raft of measures that need to be taken if climate goals are to be reached.

item.title: Singapore to pilot use of wholesale central bank digital currencies in 2024

description.#cdata-section: Singapore will pilot the live issuance and use of wholesale central bank digital currencies next year, the Monetary Authority of Singapore said Thursday.

item.title: Mastercard says wide adoption of central bank digital currencies would be ‘difficult’ right now

description.#cdata-section: The difficult part of CBDCs is adoption, Ashok Venkateswaran, Mastercard's blockchain and digital assets lead for Asia-Pacific, told CNBC.

item.title: Alibaba's Hong Kong shares drop 10% after it shelves cloud spinoff, citing U.S. chip restrictions

description.#cdata-section: Shares of Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba slid after it announced it would not proceed with the full spinoff of its cloud group.

item.title: Deflation could be coming this holiday season, Walmart CEO says

description.#cdata-section: Prices have fallen, especially on general merchandise and on some key grocery items, said Walmart chief Doug McMillon.

item.title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai compares AI to climate change at APEC CEO Summit

description.#cdata-section: Google CEO Sundar Pichai said on Thursday that people across the globe have a shared responsibility when it comes to artificial intelligence

item.title: Morgan Stanley CEO says his firm is ready for 'Basel III endgame' — the sweeping new global rules on banking

description.#cdata-section: Eventual 2, 3% inflation in the U.S. is "very acceptable" outcome, given the conditions that the Federal Reserve had to grapple with.
